bio: Throughout his long and productive career, Italian artist, designer, and writer Bruno Munari (1907-1998) contributed generously to the fields of graphic and industrial design, as well as... children's literature! He was a key member of the Italian Futurist movement with a focus on experimentation and play in his artwork. His other passion was illustrations and children's books, which are considered masterpieces in the field of children's literature. Prompts with Bruno Munari's name return elegant designs with strong composition, color play, and sexy geometrical shapes.
